text.Contract title and description: PROJ10028: Better Assistance in Crises (BASIC) Research
text.KPI name and description:
Quality of products
   Products are delivered following relevant IDS quality assurance and signed off by FCDO SRO. Four criteria:
   1) BASIC Research has submitted evidence of responses to:
   a. 2 internal reviews of products (at least 1 reviewer with 10+ years experience)
   b. 1 external review of products (at least 5+ years experience, but preferably more)
   Product then submitted to FCDO as part of quarterly report usually on the final day of the quarter. 
   Steps 2, 3 and 4 to occur after that deadline.
   2) BASIC Research has responded to FCDO reviews
   3) FCDO deems the product to be within the agreed* scope in terms of planned purpose and content
   4) FCDO signs off the product
text.Good target: When FCDO signs off the product the full amount of funds linked to that product will be released.

text.Contract title and description:
CONTRACT FOR THE PROVISION OF 
CENTRAL COMMISIONING FACILITY (CCF)
text.KPI name and description:
Scheme Spend


(Actual spend for period plus any reconciliation/accruals adjustments)
text.Good target: Total programme and infrastructure outturn spend is within ± 1% of the annually agreed budget (taking into account DHSC requirements of reconciliation and accruals)
text.Comments: The quarter three Scheme Spend forecast was 5.6% below budget, due to reported ASTOX underspend in several areas being higher than originally forecasted. The cause of the slippage had been investigated and found to be largely due to COVID-19, inability to recruit participants and reset. The risk of the impact of COVID-19 and the restarting of research had been discussed at Board meetings and it had been agreed that LGC would not be penalised for the budget variation where this was the cause.

text.Contract title and description: Extreme Poverty - Building Evidence for Effective Action
text.KPI name and description:
Appropriate and effective identification and management of risks including proposed mitigation measures:
   1. Risk Matrix submitted to FCDO for review on a quarterly basis
   2. Demonstrate steps taken to proactively detect and mitigate risks 
   3. Significant changes to the risk assessment and project delivery are reported to FCDO as soon as supplier becomes aware of them - documented via summary emails and action points post quarterly meetings.

Soft FM Satisfaction
Intent - To monitor instances that contracted services have been delivered to a sub-standard quality (i.e. Service Satisfaction Failures)
Definition - Service Satisfaction Failure: An occurrence of poor/insufficient quality e.g. A contractor fails to provide appropriate waste receptacles for the volume and type of waste generated
